text: Hi there! Just thought of asking this here in the community: does anyone know about automated internal linking tools? Thanks a bunch :partyparrot:

text: Doesn't ahrefs give automated suggestions? <https://ahrefs.com/blog/link-opportunities/>

attachments.text: What this tool does is tell you exactly where to add internal links to help rank your pages higher in Google. Why care? Well, internal links help users

text: Not a user but if you’re on Wordpress I’ve heard good things from Link Whisper <https://linkwhisper.com/> . I am not a user though and it might be that they have a good affiliate program that helps them generate good reviews, but you might want to check this out :slightly_smiling_face:

text: I also just tried Jonas’ suggestion. I did not know Ahrefs had it built in. It seems to do an okay job, I guess there’s only so much a tool can do without Deep Learning capabilities. Here’s an extract of the suggestions the tool made for my personal blog to give you an idea of how it looks and how some suggestions would obviously not be acted upon :upside_down_face: But I’m definitely going to follow some of its suggestions!

text: Does anyone know a tool that would extract the existing topic clusters from an existing site? Then provide a visual for how these pages are interlinked and which pages are linked to most? It would also be good to take in consideration contextual links vs navigation links. I’m attaching an image with what I have in mind. I know that you can get an idea based on the Search Console → Links → Internal Links report but I find that limiting.

elements.text: Does anyone know a tool that would extract the existing topic clusters from an existing site? Then provide a visual for how these pages are interlinked and which pages are linked to most? It would also be good to take in consideration contextual links vs navigation links. I’m attaching an image with what I have in mind. I know that you can get an idea based on the Search Console → Links → Internal Links report but I find that limiting.

text: Here for the replies.

elements.text: Here for the replies.

text: Hmmm I don’t know of any tool that does this automatically - not sure AI and NLP tech is quite there yet. But you can do it manually through a Sitebulb or Screaming Frog crawl, extract the content from each page and do topic-based filtering to manually visualize the existing clusters and internal link maps. A lot of work though.

elements.text: Hmmm I don’t know of any tool that does this automatically - not sure AI and NLP tech is quite there yet. But you can do it manually through a Sitebulb or Screaming Frog crawl, extract the content from each page and do topic-based filtering to manually visualize the existing clusters and internal link maps. A lot of work though.

text: Thanks Gary, yes I thought of that and I try to automate it and avoid lots of manual work especially where the site is hundreds or thousands of pages. Good input for plan B though.

elements.text: Thanks Gary, yes I thought of that and I try to automate it and avoid lots of manual work especially where the site is hundreds or thousands of pages. Good input for plan B though.

text:
May be a better question for Ronnie.

Our Airtable set up is pretty established, and we've found that it's not great for managing tasks. Asana was much better for that, especially when using repeatable checklists like this.

We basically use Airtable to manage the "big picture" stuff like due dates and production status, Notion to house SOPs, and individual discretion to manage individual tasks.
